overview_of_class: COURSE DESCRIPTION / Theory and practice of seperations and conversions in water quality and residuals management.  Gas transfer, adsorption, ion exchange, membranes, oxidation, sedimentation, flocculation, filtration.
name: Physical/Chemical Processes in Environmental Control
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 444-0-20 Physical/Chemical Processes in Environmental Control

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: COURSE DESCRIPTION / Theory and practice of seperations and conversions in water quality and residuals management. Gas transfer, adsorption, ion exchange, membranes, oxidation, sedimentation, flocculation, filtration.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: CIV_ENV 367 (Aquatic Chemistry), CIV_ENV 440 (Environmental Transport Processes) or equivalent

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. MWH's Water Treatment: Principles and Design / John C. Crittenden, R. Rhodes Trussell, David W. Hand and Kerry J. Howe / ISBN 978-0470405390 / 2012 / 3rd / Wiley

2. Transport Modeling for Environmental Engineers and Scientists / Mark M Clark / ISBN 978-0-470-26072-2 / 2010 / 2nd / Wiley

subject: CIV_ENV
